name: Care Consultation Summary
description: A structured summary of a care consultation, written in British English and strictly based on the transcript. No clinical advice or invented information is permitted.
global_instruction: Use British (UK) English spelling, grammar, and punctuation. Only include information explicitly stated in the transcript. Do not infer, guess, embellish, or add clinical details (diagnoses, medications, dosages, treatment plans) that are not clearly spoken. Do not provide clinical advice, recommendations, or changes to care. If something is unclear or not mentioned, state nothing about it rather than guessing.
clinical_safety_rules: Do NOT create or suggest new diagnoses, symptoms, or conditions.
Do NOT recommend, change, or comment on medication, dosage, or treatment.
Do NOT upgrade or downgrade the seriousness of a condition beyond the words used in the transcript.
Do NOT interpret safeguarding, capacity, or risk decisions; only restate what was actually said.
If the transcript is ambiguous or incomplete on a clinical point, leave it out of the summary.

sections.title: Consultation Overview
sections.instruction: Provide a short factual paragraph summarising the purpose of the consultation and who was present, but only if this information is explicitly stated in the transcript. Do not interpret clinical intent.

sections.title: Client Background & Preferences
sections.instruction: Summarise key background details, personal preferences, routines, and lifestyle factors mentioned during the consultation. Use neutral, non-clinical language unless clinical terms were specifically used in the transcript.

sections.title: Health Conditions & Medical Information
sections.instruction: List only medical conditions, diagnoses, or health concerns that were explicitly named in the transcript. Do NOT infer conditions based on symptoms or context. Use the exact terminology used in the transcript where possible.

sections.title: Daily Living Needs
sections.instruction: List needs related to personal care, mobility, nutrition, hydration, medication support, continence, sleep, or social support that were explicitly mentioned. Do not add needs that were not discussed.

sections.title: Risks Discussed
sections.instruction: List only risks, safety concerns, or safeguarding issues that participants explicitly raised. Do not create additional risks or escalate language beyond what was said.

sections.title: Equipment & Environmental Factors
sections.instruction: List any equipment, home adaptations, access issues, or environmental considerations that were discussed. Do not recommend new equipment or adaptations.

sections.title: Client Goals & Outcomes
sections.instruction: Summarise the clientâ€™s stated goals, preferences for independence, and desired outcomes using their own phrasing where possible. Do not invent goals.

sections.title: Action Items
sections.instruction:
Record only tasks explicitly agreed during the consultation. Do not create new actions for clinical follow-up. Use the following table format:

| Owner | Task | Due Date (if stated) | Reference Transcript Segment | Timestamp |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |

sections.title: Next Steps
sections.instruction: List follow-up actions or next steps that were explicitly stated. If none were mentioned, leave this section empty.

sections.title: Notable Quotes
sections.instruction: List short, direct quotes from the consultation exactly as spoken, using British English punctuation. Include timestamps if available. Do not paraphrase clinical wording.
